navigation.title: Type Alphabet
navigation.outcome: It is time for the students to practice typing letters and common words to increase their proficiency in digital skills. The child will learn typing on a qwerty keyboard which is important in our contemporary digital world. As children hear the sound read out-loud, see it on the screen and then type the corresponding key, the activity reinforces sound letter mapping skill in them.
navigation.subject: /Subject/en

navigation.title: Vowel Sounds
navigation.outcome: The lesson concentrates on phonic sounds of the vowels, a,e,i,o,u.
navigation.subject: /Subject/en

navigation.title: Write Vowels
navigation.outcome: Children will trace and learn the pattern of writing vowels a,e,i,o,u
navigation.subject: /Subject/en

navigation.title: Vowel words
navigation.outcome: Children will write the vowels and read the words assoicated with them like ant, egg, ice, owl, under etc
navigation.subject: /Subject/en

navigation.title: Ending 'a'
navigation.outcome: The ending sounds of 'a' are isolated from the word for the child to understand it accurately. It teaches the child how 'a' sounds when it is at the end of a word.
navigation.subject: /Subject/en

navigation.title: Ending 'e'
navigation.outcome: The ending sounds of 'e' are isolated from the word for the child to understand it accurately. It teaches the child how 'e' sounds when it is at the end of a word.
navigation.subject: /Subject/en

navigation.title: Ending 'i'
navigation.outcome: The ending sounds of 'i' are isolated from the word for the child to understand it accurately. It teaches the child how 'i' sounds when it is at the end of a word.
navigation.subject: /Subject/en

navigation.title: Ending 'o'
navigation.outcome: The ending sounds of 'o' are isolated from the word for the child to understand it accurately. It teaches the child how 'o' sounds when it is at the end of a word.
navigation.subject: /Subject/en

navigation.title: Ending 'u'
navigation.outcome: The ending sounds of 'u' are isolated from the word for the child to understand it accurately. It teaches the child how 'u' sounds when it is at the end of a word.
navigation.subject: /Subject/en

navigation.title: Medial Vowels -1
navigation.outcome: The medial sounds are isolated from the word for the child to understand it accurately. It teaches the child how vowels sound when they are in middle of a word.
navigation.subject: /Subject/en

navigation.title: Medial vowels -2
navigation.outcome: The medial sounds are isolated from the word for the child to understand it accurately. It teaches the child how vowels sound when they are in middle of a word.
navigation.subject: /Subject/en

navigation.title: Beginning Vowel Sounds
navigation.outcome: The begining vowel sounds are isolated from the word for the child to understand it accurately. Learning the phonics helps children read words easily, which is important for their learning.
navigation.subject: /Subject/en

navigation.title: Word Sounds -1
navigation.outcome: The lesson isolates each sound of the word so that the child can understand the sound independently as well as when it is merged with other sounds to form a word. These lessons are crucial in building independent reading skills in a child.
navigation.subject: /Subject/en

navigation.title: ad
navigation.outcome: Using word families can help teach beginning spellers that words contain and share patterns. Use this word family list to introduce the sound of words ending with -'ad' like mad, sad, dad etc.
navigation.subject: /Subject/en

navigation.title: at
navigation.outcome: Using word families can help teach beginning spellers that words contain and share patterns. Use this word family list to introduce the sound of words ending with -'at' like rat, cat, bat, hat etc
navigation.subject: /Subject/en

navigation.title: an
navigation.outcome: Word families are groups of words that have a common feature or pattern - they have some of the same combinations of letters in them and a similar sound here at an like man, can, ran etc
navigation.subject: /Subject/en

navigation.title: am
navigation.outcome: Teaches children words that rhyme and end with letters 'am' like dam, jam, ham etc.
navigation.subject: /Subject/en

navigation.title: ap
navigation.outcome: Teaches children words that rhyme and end with letters 'ap' like cap nap gap, etc.
navigation.subject: /Subject/en

navigation.title: ag, ay
navigation.outcome: Teaches children words that rhyme and end with letters 'ag' and 'ay' like hag/nag, hay/play etc.
navigation.subject: /Subject/en

navigation.title: ain
navigation.outcome: Children learn the words that end in 'ain' like train, rain, chain etc
navigation.subject: /Subject/en

navigation.title: art, air, are
navigation.outcome: The lesson teaches words that end with 'art', 'air', and 'are.
navigation.subject: /Subject/en

navigation.title: ake
navigation.outcome: Teaches children words that rhyme and end with letters 'ake' like bake, cake, make, etc.
navigation.subject: /Subject/en

navigation.title: ane, ave
navigation.outcome: Word family of ‘a’ includes sounds of 'ane' and 'ave' in this lesson, which reinforces learning through repetition of these letters in different words. Word family chapters will improve the speed of reading in children.
navigation.subject: /Subject/en

navigation.title: ale, ate, ade
navigation.outcome: Word family of ‘a’ includes sounds of 'ale', 'ate' and 'ade' in this lesson, which reinforces learning through repetition of these letters in different words. Word family chapters will improve the speed of reading in children.
navigation.subject: /Subject/en

navigation.title: ace, ase, ape
navigation.outcome: Word family of ‘a’ includes sounds of 'ace', 'ase' and 'ape' in this lesson, which reinforces learning through repetition of these letters in different words. Word family chapters will improve the speed of reading in children.
navigation.subject: /Subject/en

navigation.title: amp, ank, ail
navigation.outcome: Word family of ‘a’ includes sounds of 'amp', 'ank' and 'ail' in this lesson, which reinforces learning through repetition of these letters in different words. Word family chapters will improve the speed of reading in children.
navigation.subject: /Subject/en

navigation.title: ark, all
navigation.outcome: Word family of ‘a’ includes sounds of 'ark' and 'all' in this lesson, which reinforces learning through repetition of these letters in different words. Word family chapters will improve the speed of reading in children.
navigation.subject: /Subject/en

navigation.title: en,ed
navigation.outcome: Teaches rhyming words like hen, men, pen and bed, red etc
navigation.subject: /Subject/en

navigation.title: et
navigation.outcome: The lesson teaches words that end with 'et' like bet, wet, pet, met etc
navigation.subject: /Subject/en

navigation.title: eg, ea, ean
navigation.outcome: Teaches children words that rhyme and end with letters eg, ea and ean
navigation.subject: /Subject/en

navigation.title: eese, eat
navigation.outcome: This lesson gives importance to teaching word families, also called phonograms or “chunks,” which are groups of words that have a predictable pattern or “chunk.” Since word families have a common feature or pattern in the end and they all rhyme, it makes reading them easy for our early readers. They have the same letter combinations which create similar sounds. They are wonderful tools for those new to reading and for learning spellings. Here the words end in eese and eat.
navigation.subject: /Subject/en

navigation.title: id, ide
navigation.outcome: This lesson gives importance to teaching word families, also called phonograms or “chunks,” which are groups of words that have a predictable pattern or “chunk.” Since word families have a common feature or pattern in the end and they all rhyme, it makes reading them easy for our early readers. They have the same letter combinations which create similar sounds. They are wonderful tools for those new to reading and for learning spellings. Here the words end in id and ide
navigation.subject: /Subject/en

navigation.title: it, ite
navigation.outcome: Teaches children words that rhyme and end with letters it and ite like hit, bit, bite, site etc
navigation.subject: /Subject/en

navigation.title: in, ing, ink
navigation.outcome: The lesson has groups of words that have a common feature or pattern and end with wods 'in', 'ing' and 'ink'.
navigation.subject: /Subject/en

navigation.title: int, ine, irt
navigation.outcome: Read words which rhyme and end with same letters. Since it is predictable, they enjoy repeating the words, which also helps them improve their speed of reading at the same time.
navigation.subject: /Subject/en

navigation.title: ig, ix
navigation.outcome: Read words which rhyme and end with same letters. Since it is predictable, they enjoy repeating the words, which also helps them improve their speed of reading at the same time.
navigation.subject: /Subject/en

navigation.title: ip
navigation.outcome: Read words which rhyme and end with same letters. Since it is predictable, they enjoy repeating the words, which also helps them improve their speed of reading at the same time.
navigation.subject: /Subject/en

navigation.title: ie, ick, ill, ime
navigation.outcome: Read the rhyming words and end with the same letters. Since it is predictable,They enjoy repeating words, which also helps to improve them Their speed of reading at the same time.
navigation.subject: /Subject/en

navigation.title: ire, ile, ive, ike
navigation.outcome: Read words which rhyme and end with same letters. Since it is predictable, they enjoy repeating the words, which also helps them improve their speed of reading at the same time.
navigation.subject: /Subject/en

navigation.title: og, ox
navigation.outcome: Read words which rhyme and end with same letters. Since it is predictable, they enjoy repeating the words, which also helps them improve their speed of reading at the same time.
navigation.subject: /Subject/en

navigation.title: ot
navigation.outcome: The lesson teaches words that end with 'ot' like hot, dot, blot, slot etc
navigation.subject: /Subject/en

navigation.title: op
navigation.outcome: Read words which rhyme and end with same letters. Since it is predictable, they enjoy repeating the words, which also helps them improve their speed of reading at the same time.
navigation.subject: /Subject/en

navigation.title: om, oom, ome, one
navigation.outcome: Read words which rhyme and end with same letters. Since it is predictable, they enjoy repeating the words, which also helps them improve their speed of reading at the same time.
navigation.subject: /Subject/en

navigation.title: ool, own, ouse
navigation.outcome: This lesson gives importance to teaching word families, also called phonograms or “chunks,” which are groups of words that have a predictable pattern or “chunk.” Since word families have a common feature or pattern in the end and they all rhyme, it makes reading them easy for our early readers. They have the same letter combinations which create similar sounds. They are wonderful tools for those new to reading and for learning spellings. Here the words end in ool, own and ouse.
navigation.subject: /Subject/en

navigation.title: oil, orn
navigation.outcome: Read words which rhyme and end with same letters. Since it is predictable, they enjoy repeating the words, which also helps them improve their speed of reading at the same time.
navigation.subject: /Subject/en

navigation.title: un
navigation.outcome: Teaches children words that rhyme and end with letters 'un' like bun, fun, sun etc
navigation.subject: /Subject/en

navigation.title: us, ust, use, uck
navigation.outcome: The lesson has groups of words that have a common feature or pattern and end with wods 'us', 'ust', 'use' and 'uck'
navigation.subject: /Subject/en

navigation.title: ug
navigation.outcome: The lesson focuses on the word family of the letter ‘u’ and the chunk formed by combining the alphabet ‘u’ with other letters to form words ending in 'ug'.
navigation.subject: /Subject/en

navigation.title: ut, ute
navigation.outcome: The lesson focuses on the word family of the letter ‘u’ and the chunk formed by combining the alphabet ‘u’ with other letters to form words ending in 'ut' and 'ute'.
navigation.subject: /Subject/en

navigation.title: ub, ube, ud
navigation.outcome: The lesson focuses on the word family of the letter ‘u’ and the chunk formed by combining the alphabet ‘u’ with other letters to form words ending in 'ub' 'ube' and 'ud'.
navigation.subject: /Subject/en

navigation.title: um, ume, ule
navigation.outcome: The lesson focuses on the word family of the letter ‘u’ and the chunk formed by combining the alphabet ‘u’ with other letters to form words ending in 'um' 'ume' and 'ule'.
navigation.subject: /Subject/en

navigation.title: Blend - ch
navigation.outcome: Typically two or more consonants are blended together to form a single sound in diagraphs - for example the two letters c and h have two distinct sounds but when combined in words like chair they make just one sound.
navigation.subject: /Subject/en

navigation.title: Blend - ch- 2
navigation.outcome: Typically two or more consonants are blended together to form a single sound in diagraphs - for example the two letters c and h have two distinct sounds but when combined in words like chair they make just one sound.
navigation.subject: /Subject/en

navigation.title: Blend - th
navigation.outcome: Children learn the sound of consonants 't' and 'h' when blended together when they form words like that, them,then, they, this etc
navigation.subject: /Subject/en

navigation.title: Blend - th - 2
navigation.outcome: Children learn the sound of consonants 't' and 'h' when blended together when they form words like father, mother, brother etc
navigation.subject: /Subject/en

navigation.title: Blend - sh
navigation.outcome: Sh' sound blend is important since many words in English language involves the blend of these consonants. An important step in learning to read is blending the sounds we know together to make words. Children learn how consonants 's' and 'h' combine to form single sound in word like ship, shop, rush etc
navigation.subject: /Subject/en

navigation.title: Blend - sh 2
navigation.outcome: Sh' sound blend is important since many words in English language involves the blend of these consonants. An important step in learning to read is blending the sounds we know together to make words. Children learn how consonants 's' and 'h' combine to form single sound in word like shot, show, shut etc
navigation.subject: /Subject/en

navigation.title: Blend - sh - 3
navigation.outcome: Sh' sound blend is important since many words in English language involves the blend of these consonants. An important step in learning to read is blending the sounds we know together to make words. Children learn how consonants 's' and 'h' combine to form single sound in word like fresh, push, shake etc
navigation.subject: /Subject/en

navigation.title: Blend - wh
navigation.outcome: An important step in learning to read is blending the sounds we know together to make words. Children learn how consonants 'w' and 'h' combine in words like what, which, whiz etc
navigation.subject: /Subject/en

navigation.title: Blend - ck
navigation.outcome: Teaches about how two consonants 'c' and 'k' blend to create a single sound in words like clock, duck, black etc
navigation.subject: /Subject/en

navigation.title: Blend - ck- 2
navigation.outcome: Teaches about how two consonants 'c' and 'k' blend to create a single sound in words like kick, truck, chick etc
navigation.subject: /Subject/en

navigation.title: Blend - gr
navigation.outcome: An important step in learning to read is blending the sounds we know together to make words. Children learn how consonants 'g' and 'r' combine to form single sound in words grow, green, grandma etc
navigation.subject: /Subject/en

navigation.title: Blend - cr
navigation.outcome: Children learn the sound of consonants 'c' and 'r' when blended together when they form words like crab, cross, crib etc
navigation.subject: /Subject/en

navigation.title: Blend - st
navigation.outcome: Teaches about how two consonants 's' and 't' blend to create a single sound in words.
navigation.subject: /Subject/en

navigation.title: Blend - oi
navigation.outcome: Teaches about how two consonants 'o' and 'i' blend to create a single sound in words.
navigation.subject: /Subject/en

navigation.title: Blend - pl
navigation.outcome: An important step in learning to read is blending the sounds we know together to make words. Children learn how consonants 'p' and 'l' combine to form single sound in words.
navigation.subject: /Subject/en

navigation.title: Blend - tr
navigation.outcome: Children learn the sound of consonants 't' and 'r' when blended together when they form words like train, tree, tray etc
navigation.subject: /Subject/en

navigation.title: Blend - sk
navigation.outcome: Teaches about how two consonants 's' and 'k' blend to create a single sound in words.
navigation.subject: /Subject/en

navigation.title: Blend - ue
navigation.outcome: Teaches about how two consonants 'u' and 'e' blend to create a single sound in words.
navigation.subject: /Subject/en

navigation.title: Blend - ow
navigation.outcome: An important step in learning to read is blending the sounds we know together to make words. Children learn how consonants 'o' and 'w' combine to form single sound in word like grow, slow etc
navigation.subject: /Subject/en

navigation.title: Blend - ar
navigation.outcome: Children learn the sound of consonants 'a' and 'r' when blended together when they form words like farm, heart etc
navigation.subject: /Subject/en

navigation.title: Blend - ar - 2
navigation.outcome: Children learn the sound of consonants 'a' and 'r' when blended together when they form words like farm, arm, park etc
navigation.subject: /Subject/en

navigation.title: Blend - dr
navigation.outcome: Children learn the sound of consonants 'd' and 'r' when blended together when they form words like drum, drive etc
navigation.subject: /Subject/en

navigation.title: Blend - bl
navigation.outcome: Learn how the two letter 'b' and 'l' blend together to form words like Blow, blouse, black etc
navigation.subject: /Subject/en

navigation.title: Blend - fl
navigation.outcome: Teaches about how two consonants 'f' and 'l' blend to create a single sound in words like fly, flower, floor etc
navigation.subject: /Subject/en

navigation.title: Blend - cl
navigation.outcome: Teaches about how two consonants 'c' and 'l' blend to create a single sound in words like clock, class etc
navigation.subject: /Subject/en

navigation.title: Blend - oa
navigation.outcome: Children learn the sound of consonants 'o' and 'a' when blended together when they form words like coat, boat, soap etc
navigation.subject: /Subject/en

navigation.title: Blend - ea
navigation.outcome: Children learn the sound of consonants 'e' and 'a' when blended together when they form words like leaf, sea etc
navigation.subject: /Subject/en

navigation.title: Blend - ea - 2
navigation.outcome: An important step in learning to read is blending the sounds we know together to make words. Children learn how consonants 'e' and 'a' combine to form single sound in word like head, cream etc
navigation.subject: /Subject/en

navigation.title: Blend - ou
navigation.outcome: An important step in learning to read is blending the sounds we know together to make words. Children learn how consonants 'o' and 'u' combine to form single sound in word like count, house, mouse etc
navigation.subject: /Subject/en

navigation.title: Blend - ai
navigation.outcome: Children learn about blending the sounds together to make words. They learn how consonants 'a' and 'i' combine to form single sound in word like train, rain, hair, etc
navigation.subject: /Subject/en

navigation.title: Animal Names -1
navigation.outcome: The lesson aims to develop students' vocabulary by encouraging curiosity about the meaning and use of unfamiliar words and promoting the use of strategies that will help students find the names of animals through images of Ball and Dog, Bird, Bugs, Cat and Butterfly etc. The puzzles are very engaging.
navigation.subject: /Subject/en

navigation.title: Animal Names -2
navigation.outcome: The lesson aims to develop students' vocabulary by encouraging curiosity about the meaning and use of unfamiliar words and promoting the use of strategies that will help students find the names of animals through images of Hyena, lizard, meerkuts etc. The puzzles are a bit advanced very engaging.
navigation.subject: /Subject/en

navigation.title: Animals
navigation.outcome: The lesson teaches children not only about animals but also about the animal body parts unique to them, like trunk of an elephant, whiskers of cat etc. It has images of cats, lion, rat, bee, elephant, sea animals, wild animals and farm animals
navigation.subject: /Subject/en

navigation.title: Food
navigation.outcome: Children learn words associated cooking, lunch, party, and food with the help of clues through given through images.
navigation.subject: /Subject/en

navigation.title: Fruits and Vegetables
navigation.outcome: By matching the fruits and vegetables with their images, children will become familiar with thier names. They learn about By matching the animals with their images, children will become familiar with animal names and also learn about their habitats. They learn about fruits, tropical fruits, vegetables and many more.
navigation.subject: /Subject/en

navigation.title: Playing
navigation.outcome: Children learn words associated playing like football, toys, playground, slide, different types of balls etc with the help of clues through given through images.
navigation.subject: /Subject/en

navigation.title: Transport
navigation.outcome: Children learn about vehices and words associated with them through images.
navigation.subject: /Subject/en

navigation.title: World
navigation.outcome: Children learn words associated with sky, space, nature etc by matching words with images.
navigation.subject: /Subject/en

navigation.title: Places
navigation.outcome: The lesson teaches words associated with village, classroom, farm etc by matching words with images.
navigation.subject: /Subject/en

navigation.title: Day to day
navigation.outcome: Children improve their English language skills by learning words which tells them about different time in a day, weather, etc
navigation.subject: /Subject/en

navigation.title: Activities
navigation.outcome: Children can see the images with activities and learn sentences associated with it like - They can learn words assoicated with acitvities like painting, fishing etc
navigation.subject: /Subject/en

navigation.title: Nature
navigation.outcome: Children learn words associated nature like,forest, trees, pond etc. with the help of clues through given through images.
navigation.subject: /Subject/en

navigation.title: Maths
navigation.outcome: The lesson teaches number names - one,two etc and shapes like circle, square etc.
navigation.subject: /Subject/en

navigation.title: Practice More Words
navigation.outcome: The child will learn words related to clothes, letter, mail, senses, hair etc
navigation.subject: /Subject/en

navigation.title: Describe
navigation.outcome: Children learn sentences with adjectives that describe person, place or a thing. Eg -Two lions, A tall boy, A little cat, She is happy etc
navigation.subject: /Subject/en

navigation.title: Colours
navigation.outcome: Children learn about colours through simple sentences like An orange hat, A red ball, A green book etc.
navigation.subject: /Subject/en

navigation.title: Profession
navigation.outcome: Children learn the names of people in a specific profession like - Doctor, farmer, teacher etc
navigation.subject: /Subject/en

navigation.title: Activities
navigation.outcome: Children learn words associated activities like painting, fishing andf washing with the help of clues through given through images.
navigation.subject: /Subject/en

navigation.title: Simple Sentences
navigation.outcome: Children learn to create simple sentences with the help of the image. The basic sentences are like - He can't jump high, He is a cook, He is eating salad, He is swimming etc.
navigation.subject: /Subject/en

navigation.title: Simple sentences = 2
navigation.outcome: Children learn to create simple sentences with the help of the image. The basic sentences are like - He can't jump high, He is a cook, He is eating salad, He is swimming etc.
navigation.subject: /Subject/en

navigation.title: 3 Letters
navigation.outcome: The Chapter ensures that children get enough practice of tracing words. Students practice scribbling small words formed with 3 letters.
navigation.subject: /Subject/en

navigation.title: 4 letters
navigation.outcome: The lesson ensures that children get enough practice of tracing 4 letter words. It reinforces learning of words which has happened in the previous chapters by helping the child to identify letters in a word besides identifying the name of each letter.
navigation.subject: /Subject/en

navigation.title: 5 letters
navigation.outcome: The lesson teaches children a sense of directionality in writing. They trace and decode short, familiar meaningful 5 letter words with gradually increasing accuracy.
navigation.subject: /Subject/en

navigation.title: 6 letters
navigation.outcome: The lesson teaches children a sense of directionality in writing. They trace and decode short, familiar meaningful 6 letter words with gradually increasing accuracy.
navigation.subject: /Subject/en

navigation.title: Type Alpahbet
navigation.outcome: The speed of typing is tested for children here as they recognize the letter and type them. It is time for the students to practice typing letters and common words to increase their proficiency in digital skills. The child will learn typing on a qwerty keyboard which is important in our contemporary digital world. As children hear the sound read out-loud, see it on the screen and then type the corresponding key, the activity reinforces sound letter mapping skill in them.
navigation.subject: /Subject/en

navigation.title: Type Words
navigation.outcome: The speed of typing is tested for children here as they recognize the word and type them. It is time for the students to practice typing letters and common words to increase their proficiency in digital skills. The child will learn typing on a qwerty keyboard which is important in our contemporary digital world. As children hear the sound read out-loud, see it on the screen and then type the corresponding key, the activity reinforces sound letter mapping skill in them.
navigation.subject: /Subject/en

navigation.title: Tiny Words - 1
navigation.outcome: Children will practice spellings of small words like dad, bed, pig, red etc
navigation.subject: /Subject/en

navigation.title: Tiny Words - 2
navigation.outcome: English spellings are one of the foundational skills which is essential for successful written communication. Children have to learn proper ways to spell words in their early stages of learning, since a word learnt to spell wrong will have to be unlearned to learn right spellings. The lesson teaches simple 3 letter words.
navigation.subject: /Subject/en

navigation.title: Big words
navigation.outcome: Children learn to spell properly bigger words like stick, shoes, heart, house, train etc to stengthen their foundation in spellings.
navigation.subject: /Subject/en

navigation.title: Big Words - 2
navigation.outcome: With the help of images and puzzles, the lessons help children identify letters by sight, and build associations between written patterns, vocal expressions, their meaning and learn the accurate spellings of words like house, stick, shoes etc
navigation.subject: /Subject/en

navigation.title: Bigger words
navigation.outcome: With the help of images and puzzles, the lessons help children identify letters by sight, and build associations between written patterns, vocal expressions, their meaning and learn the accurate spellings of words like money, woman etc
navigation.subject: /Subject/en

navigation.title: Simple sentence - 2 words
navigation.outcome: The lesson teaches basic sentences to children. Though the sentences are short, they are well-formed sentences with correct grammar which is necessary for children to learn about the rules of their language. Here the sentences are of 2 words like 'Ram eats', 'Birds fly', 'Salma walks', etc which are complete in itself.
navigation.subject: /Subject/en

navigation.title: Simple Sentence - 3 words
navigation.outcome: The lesson teaches basic sentences to children. Though the sentences are short, they are well-formed sentences with correct grammar which is necessary for children to learn about the rules of their language. Here the sentences are of 3 words like 'I am fast', 'The plant grows', 'You are kind', etc which are complete in itself.
navigation.subject: /Subject/en

navigation.title: Simple sentence - 4 words
navigation.outcome: The lesson teaches basic sentences to children. Though the sentences are short, they are well-formed sentences with correct grammar which is necessary for children to learn about the rules of their language. Here the sentences are of 4 words like 'The girl is hungry', 'Where is the cat?', 'They are my brothers', etc which are complete in itself.
navigation.subject: /Subject/en

navigation.title: About people
navigation.outcome: The lesson teaches basic sentences to children. Though the sentences are short, they are well-formed sentences with correct grammar which is necessary for children to learn about the rules of their language. Here the sentences are about people like 'Mary is a girl', 'Anand is a boy', 'Salma and Rita are students', etc which are complete in itself.
navigation.subject: /Subject/en

navigation.title: Day to day life
navigation.outcome: The lesson teaches basic sentences to children. They are well-formed sentences with correct grammar which is necessary for children to learn about the rules of their language. Here the sentences are about everyday activities like 'Mary eats an apple everyday', 'They sell milk together', 'The rooster crows every morning', etc which have more meaning.
navigation.subject: /Subject/en

navigation.title: About things
navigation.outcome: The lesson teaches basic sentences to children. They are well-formed sentences with correct grammar which is necessary for children to learn about the rules of their language. Here the sentences are about things like 'It is a red ball', 'It is a large aeroplance', 'Where is the bat?', etc which gives some details about things around us.
navigation.subject: /Subject/en
